topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Configuring and Deploying an Application Lifecycle Service Cluster

body.p: This document explains the process to configure and deploy an Application Lifecycle Service (ALS) cluster from the Horizon user interface.
The document covers the following sections:

li.xref: Configuring and Deploying an ALS Cluster

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: You need to install the Helion Development Platform and the Application Lifecycle Service.

ol.li: In the Horizon UI, from the Project tab, open the Application Lifecycle Service tab, and select the Clusters sub-tab.
Click Create Cluster to bring up the Create Cluster dialog.

Fill out the required fields in the Details tab of the Create Cluster dialog, including
Title - name of cluster
Prefix - DNS acceptable hostname string (not fully qualified DNS name) used to name the virtual machines created for the cluster.
Admin Email
Admin Password
Availability Zone - where the cluster will be created.
DEA flavor - Droplet Execution Agents (DEAs) are responsible for running and staging applications in ALS. DEA flavors specify different amounts of RAM available per DEA instance, ranging from 0.5GB to 16GB. Note: ALS DEA Nodes must be m1.medium or larger. Sizes m1.tiny and m1.small are too small to support the ALS Virtual Machine Image and will trigger an error state.
DEA Instance Count - the number of DEA instances to use in the cluster.
Key Pair - required for authentication.
Click on the Networking tab of the Create Cluster dialog and drag an available network to the Selected Networks area.
Select the Application Services tab of the Create Cluster dialog. Select the application services to enable in this cluster.
Select the Database tab of the Create Cluster dialog, and choose the databases to enable in the cluster. Detailed notes on how to create or connect to a MySQL database can be found here.

Click on the Proxies tab of the Create Cluster dialog and enter the addresses of the proxy servers for your environment (if any). Be sure to use the correct protocol prefixes and specify the correct port numbers.
Click Create. You will see the cluster building as shown below.
Once the cluster has been built, you can access it by clicking on the URL of the created cluster, which can be reached in the Clusters view or by the Cluster Details page.
The Application Lifecycle Service Documentation provides an overview of how to administer and use the configured cluster.
